item.title: Argentina's President Pledged Fiscal Shock Therapy. So Far, He's Delivering Economic Pain.
item.description: Poverty, hunger and food prices are rising, but Javier Milei says the “promise of prosperity” is at hand if his overhaul can take hold.

item.title: Antisemites Try to Call The Tune AtEurovision
item.description: Despite a menacing mob and boycott calls, Israeli singer Eden Golan almost won the popular vote.

item.title: There's Not Enough Power for America's High-Tech Ambitions
item.description: Georgia is a magnet for data centers and other cutting-edge industries, but vast electricity demands are clashing with the newcomers’ green-energy goals.

item.title: Musk and Trump: Eerie Parallels
item.description: One was the most important person in the world. The other was president.

item.title: As Silicon Valley Pivots to Patriotic Capital, China Ties Linger
item.description: Investors with connections to China are backing startups developing tech that the U.S. wants to counter Beijing.

item.title: In Rafah, Israel Reaches for a Knockout Punch That's Proved Elusive
item.description: More than 300,000 Palestinians have fled Rafah, as Israel expanded operations there and new battles broke out in previously cleared areas farther north.

item.title: Baseball's Most-Hyped Pitching Prospect Gets the Fast Track
item.description: Paul Skenes’s rapid ascent to the majors after only 12 minor-league starts speaks to a wider trend in the sport.

item.title: What Does Biden Think 'Never Again' Means?
item.description: Holocaust remembrance is the easy part.

item.title: From Green Innovation to Climate Socialism
item.description: The much-ballyhooed ‘transition’ to unconventional energy won’t happen anytime soon.

item.title: Resist the Prosecution but Obey the Court
item.description: The rule of law provides remedies by which legally erroneous orders of judges may be corrected.

item.title: What Executives Won't Admit
item.description: They’d rather repeat meaningless metaphors like ‘green shoots.’

item.title: Wealth Managers, Charities Defend Fees From Donor-Advised Funds
item.description: “Strange bedfellows” are teaming up to oppose a Treasury Department proposal penalizing certain payments.

item.title: Regulator, Regulate Thyself
item.description: Catch up to the banks.

item.title: Airlines Want to Use AI to Reduce Environmental Impact of Contrails
item.description: Researchers are looking at how the technology can help pilots avoid conditions where contrails can form.

item.title: What You Need to Know About Managing Expenses to Buy and Stay in Your Home
item.description: A podcast series examines sustainable homeownership by outlining the financial implications of buying a house.

item.title: The Secret to Talking to an AI Chatbot
item.description: Research reveals how to phrase questions to get the best responses. But that can lead to some unusual requests.

item.title: Evangelist Franklin Graham Says Democratic Politics Have Turned Against Religion
item.description: Whereas the late Billy Graham warned against crossing the line with politicians, his son owns a Trump-endorsed Bible.

item.title: More »
item.description: My mom and dad owned competing side-by-side hardware stores. It was an education in business and life.

item.title: How Helpful Are Mental-Health Chatbots?
item.description: Advances in AI technology are opening up new possibilities, researchers say, but chatbots are still no substitute for a human therapist.

item.title: Justice Brett Kavanaugh Wants More Cases---but Don't Rush
item.description: The conservative says the Supreme Court can expand its workload but feels the strain when litigants seek emergency intervention before the legal process runs its normal course.
